stimulusHtml: Object A of mass m=1.0kg initially moves with a speed v=15m/s to the right towards Object B of mass m=2.0kg, which is initially at rest. After the collision, Object A rebounds with a speed v=5m/s to the left and Object B moves with a speed v=10m/s to the right. Which of the following correctly indicates if the collision is elastic, and justifies this response?
choicesHtml: The collision is elastic because the momentum of the two-object system before the collision is equal to the momentum of the system after the collision.
The collision is elastic because the kinetic energy of the two-object system before the collision is equal to the kinetic energy of the system after the collision.
The collision is not elastic because the momentum of the two-object system before the collision is not equal to the momentum of the system after the collision.
The collision is not elastic because the kinetic energy of the two-object system before the collision is not equal to the kinetic energy of the system after the collision.
